articles.title: Workers are seeking out AI training to prepare for the jobs of tomorrow
articles.summary: Working professionals and young people are investing in artificial intelligence courses, programs and degrees as the technology promises to transform jobs.

articles.title: CNBC Daily Open: The U.S. government gets a slice of the AI pie
articles.summary: U.S. stocks have received a strong boost from the artificial intelligence boom, ending the week on a high note.

articles.title: Meta And Microsoft Are Betting Big On AI - So Is The C-Suite
articles.summary: Like Meta and Microsoft, CxOs are fast-tracking artificial intelligence not as a future play, but as a present-day growth lever.
articles.translated_title: Meta And Microsoft Are Betting Big On AI - So Is The C-Suite
articles.translated_summary: Like Meta and Microsoft, CxOs are fast-tracking artificial intelligence not as a future play, but as a present-day growth lever.

articles.title: Exclusive: SK Hynix expects AI memory market to grow 30% a year to 2030
articles.summary: South Korea's SK Hynix forecasts that the market for a specialized form of memory chip designed for artificial intelligence will grow 30% a year until 2030, a senior executive said in an interview with Reuters.
articles.translated_title: Exclusive: SK Hynix expects AI memory market to grow 30% a year to 2030
articles.translated_summary: South Korea's SK Hynix forecasts that the market for a specialized form of memory chip designed for artificial intelligence will grow 30% a year until 2030, a senior executive said in an interview with Reuters.

articles.title: Nvidia, AMD To Pay 15% Of China Chip Sale Revenues To U.S., Official Says
articles.summary: Nvidia and AMD have agreed to give the U.S. government 15% of revenue from sales to China of advanced computer chips like Nvidia's H20 that are used for artificial intelligence applications, a U.S. official told Reuters on Sunday.
articles.translated_title: Nvidia, AMD To Pay 15% Of China Chip Sale Revenues To U.S., Official Says
articles.translated_summary: Nvidia and AMD have agreed to give the U.S. government 15% of revenue from sales to China of advanced computer chips like Nvidia's H20 that are used for artificial intelligence applications, a U.S. official told Reuters on Sunday.

articles.title: Nvidia China H20 chips
articles.summary: Nvidia pushed back Sunday in response to allegations from Chinese state media that its H20 artificial intelligence chips are a national security risk for China.

articles.title: Investors Flee Companies Seen as Most at Risk From Artificial Intelligence
articles.summary: Investors are exhibiting growing concerns over the potential upheaval caused by AI in various sectors.
